intro: Ornithogalum glaucescens, commonly known as the bluebell lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of pale blue to white bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms in late summer to early autumn. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. Ornithogalum glaucescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
